Offaly|Offaly]] <small>(current)</small> | country = [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | first = 1931 | last = | organizer = National Ploughing Association | filing = | attendance = 291,500 <small>(2017)</small> | website = {{url|npa.ie/}} }} The '''National Ploughing Championships''' ({{lang-ga|Comórtas Náisiúnta Treabhdóireachta}}) (previously known as The '''National Ploughing Championships Machinery & Livestock Exhibition'''<ref name="mog05npa">{{cite web|url=http://www.npa.ie/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050305200057/http://www.npa.ie/ |deadurl=yes|publisher=National Ploughing Association of Ireland |title=National Ploughing Championships Machinery & Livestock Exhibition 2005|archivedate=5 March 2005 |date=2005|accessdate=1 October 2015}}</ref><ref name="balla02">{{cite web|url=http://www.npa.ie/champs02.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020802015110/http://www.npa.ie/champs02.html |deadurl=yes|publisher=National Ploughing Association of Ireland |title=The National Ploughing Championships Machinery & Livestock Exhibition 2002|archivedate=2 August 2002 |date=2002|accessdate=1 October 2015}}</ref>) or (NPC) is an outdoor [[agricultural show]] in [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] incorporating a [[ploughing contest]].<ref name="IT2015">{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151001093300/https://www.irishtimes.com/business/agribusiness-and-food/ploughing-championships-president-attends-first-day-1.2361317 |deadurl=no |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/business/agribusiness-and-food/ploughing-championships-president-attends-first-day-1.2361317 |archivedate=1 October 2015|work=[[Irish Times]] |first1=Rachel |last1=Flaherty|first2=Dan |last2=Griffin |accessdate=1 October 2015 |date=22 September 2015 |title=Ploughing championships: President attends first day}}</ref> Held every September, it draws over 1,500 exhibitors and achieves attendances of over 280,000.<ref name="IT2015"/>
==History== The first Irish [[Counties of Ireland|inter-county]] [[ploughing contest]] was held between County Wexford and County Kildare on 16 February 1931 in a 26-acre field at Coursetown in [[Athy]] in [[County Kildare]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=A Ploughing People: Farming Life Celebrated, Stories, Traditions, The Championships|last=Cox|first=Valerie|publisher=Hachette Books Ireland|year=2017|isbn=978-1-473-65945-2|location=Ireland|page=4}}</ref> Since then, the National Ploughing Championships has expanded to over 800 acres with 1,700 exhibitors.<ref>{{cite news |accessdate=2 October 2017 |title=National Ploughing Championships 2017: Tractor highlights on-site |url=http://www.agriland.ie/farming-news/tractor-highlights-on-site-at-this-years-national-ploughing-championships/|publisher=Agriland|date=18 September 2017 }}</ref><ref name="overview2012">{{cite web|url=http://www.npa.ie/media-2/overviewbackground-of-event/ |title=Background of Event/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120915050821/http://www.npa.ie/media-2/overviewbackground-of-event/ |deadurl=no |accessdate=1 October 2015 |archivedate=15 September 2012 |date=2012 |publisher=National Ploughing Association}}</ref> It has been extended beyond ploughing, farming or machinery enthusiasts, to now featuring attractions such as a tented trade village, live entertainment, music & dancing, fashion shows, craft village, live cooking demonstrations, celebrity appearances, sheep dog trials, pony games & welly throwing.<ref name="qualFreight">{{cite web|date=August 2015 |title=NPC 2015 |url=http://qualityfreight.com/news/40-npc-2015 |archivedate=24 November 2015 |publisher=Quality Freight |accessdate=24 November 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151124161715/http://qualityfreight.com/news/40-npc-2015}}</ref>
In 2014 the event attracted a record 279,500 visitors, 281,000 in 2015, 283,000 in 2016 and 291,500 in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.npa.ie/|title=National Ploughing Championships - home page|publisher=National Ploughing Association|accessdate=21 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.npa.ie|title=National Ploughing Association of Ireland|last=|first=|date=2016|website=|publisher=National Ploughing Association|access-date=}}</ref><ref name="Agriland2017">{{cite news |url=http://www.agriland.ie/farming-news/ploughing-2017-achieves-record-crowds-of-291500/ |title=National Ploughing Championships 2017: Tractor highlights on-site |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171002121352/http://www.agriland.ie/farming-news/tractor-highlights-on-site-at-this-years-national-ploughing-championships/ |publisher=Agriland |date=21 September 2017 |archivedate=2 October 2017 |deadurl=no |accessdate=2 October 2017}}</ref>
[[File:Pole Climbing.jpg|thumb|All Ireland Pole climbing competition at the National Ploughing Championships in 2011]]
===The Founding Fathers<ref>{{Cite book|title=A Ploughing People|last=Valerie|first=Cox|publisher=Hachette Books Ireland|year=2017|isbn=978-1-473-65945-2|location=Ireland|pages=13–32. https://books.google.ie/books?id=tmmHDgAAQBAJ&pg=PA29&lpg=PA29&dq=Charles+de+Gaulle%2BSean+O%27Farrell&source=bl&ots=Nzfrs0uXxt&sig=WxxnIYw92TYWa-lbs7qlDNJ60cM&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjd35mj2_PbAhUDLMAKHTxCB_wQ6AEIPjAH#v=onepage&q=Charles%20de%20Gaulle%2BSean%20O'Farrell&f=false}}</ref>=== The original mission statement for the National Ploughing Association, the body organising the championships, was set out as: "To bring the message of good ploughing to all parts of the country and to provide a pleasant and friendly place to meet and do business".<ref>{{Cite web|work=npa.ie |url = http://www.npa.ie/media-2/history-of-the-npa-championships/ |title = History of the NPA & Championships: Formation & Origins of the National Ploughing Association 1931 – 2012|date = |accessdate =24 November 2015 }}</ref>
One of the co-founders of the Association, JJ Bergin, became its first managing director. In 1952 he represented Ireland at the first meeting of the World Ploughing Organisation (WPO) and was appointed their vice president.<ref name="Independent Newspapers">{{Cite web|url = http://www.independent.ie/business/farming/ploughing-championships/milestones-in-the-history-of-the-national-ploughing-championships-26773612.html|title = Milestones in the history of the National ploughing championships|access-date = |website = Business: Ploughing Championships|publisher = Independent Newspapers|last = |first = }}</ref> The first World Contest was hosted by [[Canada]] in 1953, and the second was in [[Killarney]], [[County Kerry]], Ireland in 1954. That was also the first European venue for the ‘Worlds’, when 10 countries competed. Also in 1954, the first ploughing competition for women was introduced, called the 'Farmerette' class, and which was open to girls and single, married or widowed women and without reference to age. The winner was known as 'Queen of the Plough'.<ref name="Independent Newspapers"/> In 1955 the National Ploughing Championships expanded into a 2-day event. The Association became a limited liability company and was incorporated on 2 March 1956, with number of directors limited to forty, with period of office of one year; its liability limited by guarantee and without shares.
JJ Bergin continued to manage NPA until his passing in 1958.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.independent.ie/business/farming/ploughing-championships/milestones-in-the-history-of-the-national-ploughing-championships-26773612.html|title = Milestones in the history of the National ploughing championships|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
When the founding Managing Director of NPA, JJ Bergin, died in 1958, NPA appointed [[Kilkenny GAA|Kilkenny]] [[All-Ireland Hurling Final|All-Ireland hurling winner]] [[Sean O' (John) Farrell|Seán O'Farrell]] as Managing Director, a role he held until his death in 1972.<ref>{{Cite book|title=A Ploughing People|last=Cox|first=Valerie|publisher=Hachette Books Ireland|year=2017|isbn=978-1-473-65945-2|location=Ireland|page=27}}</ref> A national bread baking competition was introduced by NPA in co-operation with ESB in 1958 that continues to this day. In 1959 he represented the NPA at the 7th World Ploughing Contest to [[Armoy, County Antrim]], [[Northern Ireland]] and that was the first time they held there.<ref name="Past World Events">{{Cite web|url = http://worldploughing.org/?page_id=149|title = Past World Events|date = |access-date = |website = |publisher = World Ploughing Organisation|last = |first = }}</ref> He attended the 8th World Ploughing Contest in Tor Mancina, [[Rome]], Italy 1960<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.npa.ie/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/history9.gif|title = History of the NPA & Championships|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> where he proudly presented a distinctive block of his native [[Kilkenny Marble]] as Ireland’s contribution to Rome’s ‘Cairn of Peace’<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://peace.maripo.com/p_stones.htm|title = Cairns of Peace erected during annual World Ploughing Matches|date = |accessdate = |website = 67 Peace Stones, Rocks, Slabs & Cairns Around the World|publisher = Peace Monuments|last = |first = }}</ref> in 1960<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.npa.ie/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/history5.gif|title = History of the NPA & Championships|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> One of the highlights of his tenure of office was in 1961 when representing Ireland at 9th World Ploughing Contest, [[Thiverval-Grignon]], France. He was officially introduced to President of the French Republic, [[Charles De Gaulle]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=A Ploughing People|last=Cox|first=Valerie|publisher=Hachette Books Ireland|year=2017|isbn=978-1-473-65945-2|location=Ireland|page=29}}</ref> John was a big man over 6 ft. but he proudly displayed that photo on his wall, dwarfed as he was by the 6’ 5" tall President De Gaulle. Another big event was when the first ever Ploughing Championships were filmed by RTÉ at Killarney in 1961, believed to be the first outside coverage by the new television station. It was filmed on 8 and 9 November 1961 and broadcast in the first ever episode of the farming programme ‘On the Land’, on 1 January 1962. The film, featuring both local organiser, Mrs Grosvenor, and Seán, was remarkable in that it was broadcast the day after [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|Teilifís Éireann]] first went on air.<ref>{{cite web|title=“It’s a little bit bumpy for top class ploughing” 1961|url=http://www.rte.ie/archives/exhibitions/2257-on-the-farm/639454-first-ploughing-championships-on-rt-tv/|website=RTÉ Archives|publisher=RTÉ National TV}}</ref> [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|Teilifís Éireann]] Archives, itself founded on 1 June 1960, released in 2016 this video from 1961 of then NPA MD, Seán, and current NPA MD, Anna May, at the presentation of the NPC Farmerette trophy to Eiline Brennan from Laois being crowned Queen of the Plough, 1961.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.rte.ie/archives/category/environment/2013/0925/476327-queen-of-the-plough-1961/|title=Farmerettes At The Ploughing 1961|last=|first=|date=1961|website=RTE Archives|publisher=RTE|access-date=}}</ref>
Seán continued to build on NPA’s international profile and in 1964 the NPA sent two competitors to Fuchsenbigl, near [[Vienna]], [[Austria]], where Ireland won their first World Title when the late Charlie Keegan, from [[County Wicklow]] was the winner. It marked a huge Irish International achievement for NPA at that time and was an inspiration to future competitors, demonstrating that the Irish had the standard and the potential to compete with the best in the world. Arriving home from the world contest in Vienna,<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://worldploughing.org/?page_id=369|title = Champions of the World Ploughing Contests since 1953|date = |accessdate = |website = World Ploughing Organisation|publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> the Wicklow man was proudly brought home to [[Enniskerry]], [[County Wicklow]] on an open top bus to be met by bonfires along the roadside as they greeted NPA’s first World Ploughing Champion.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.irishtimes.com/polopoly_fs/1.1936932.1411332663!/image/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/box_620_330/image.jpg|title = Charlie Keegan, World Champion, winning the 12th World Ploughing Contest, Fuchsenbigl, Near Vienna, Austria 1964|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> That was a special day for Sean,<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ajulFr21X28/VClqzr3uJxI/AAAAAAAACeA/cwo9xeeWQXc/s1600/1962-17-07%2BPloughing%2BChampionship,%2BWicklow%2BC138-8713.jpg|title = NPA Managing Direction Seán O'Farrell on location with Charlie Keegan and co at the Ploughing Championships, Kilmacanogue, County Wicklow, 17 July 1962|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> as [[County Wicklow]] was his adopted county. The [[Irish Times]] reported how the tractor on which Charlie Keegan won World Ploughing Championships in 1964 had now been restored. It was a green Deutz D40L tractor that was magnificently restored to its original condition by his grandson, Michael, devoting 1,000 hours to restoration work.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.irishtimes.com/news/ireland/irish-news/tractor-on-which-charlie-keegan-won-world-ploughing-championships-in-1964-restored-1.1936935|title = Tractor on which Charlie Keegan won World Ploughing Championships in 1964 restored|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
At the National Championships 1964, a new Youth class was introduced for Youths 21-28. In 1965 [[Esso]] became an NPA sponsor and introduced the Esso Supreme Trophy which is still presented to the Senior Conventional Champion annually. In 1966 a new competition was introduced to cater for Students from the Agricultural Colleges. In 1969 the [[Irish Countrywomen's Association]] (ICA) were invited to give demonstrations in cookery and crafts. This also combined with introduction of the Country Markets as the ploughing was an ideal venue to sell produce. Seán held the position of MD until his sudden death in 1972. The [[Kilkenny People]] in their September 1972 obituary recorded that he was NPA Managing Director and a member of World Ploughing Organisation and that the graveside oration was delivered by [[Seán Ó Síocháin]], General Secretary of [[Gaelic Athlethic Association|GAA]].
===A Dream Fulfilled=== The second half of the NPA's 84-year story was led by NPA's long serving Secretary of that time from 1954, Anna May McHugh. In 1973 she was appointed NPA's managing director. Anna May, has served for 61 years as Secretary of the NPA organisation. She brought to fruition what was once a big idea of NPA founders back in 1931, what became a dream by 1958, and what had been just aspiration by 1972 - turning their collective dream into reality by 2018. And in September 2015, National Ploughing Association Managing Director Anna May McHugh was awarded the [[Order of Agricultural Merit|Officier de l’Ordre du Mérite Agricole]] by the French Ambassador to Ireland Mr Jean-Pierre Thébault.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.npa.ie/2015/09/ordre-du-merite-agricole-conferral-to-mrs-anna-may-mchugh/|title = Ordre du Mérite Agricole Conferral to Mrs Anna May McHugh|date = 2015|accessdate = |website = Irish National Ploughing Association|publisher = NPA|last = |first = }}</ref> Anna May is the Irish Board Member to the Board of the World Ploughing Organisation, where her daughter, Anna Marie McHugh, is now General Secretary.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://worldploughing.org/?page_id=43|title = Structure|date = |accessdate = |website = WPO|publisher = World Ploughing Organisation|last = |first = }}</ref>
1973 was also the year when 20th World Ploughing Contest was held in [[County Wexford]] in a four-day contest that was attended by 100,000 people, and when 25 countries took part. Further World Ploughing events have since been held in Ireland with 29th World Ploughing Contest in Wexford in 1981; the 43rd World Ploughing Contest at [[Teagasc#Teagasc Colleges and Research Centres|Oak Park]], [[County Carlow]] in 1996 and the 53rd World Ploughing Contest at [[Tullow]] [[County Carlow]] in 2006.<ref name="Past World Events"/> In 1994 Wexford man Martin Kehoe brought home the first of his three World Champion titles - in 1994 from [[Outram, New Zealand|Outram]], near Dunedin, New Zealand; in 1995 from [[Egerton University|Egerton]], [[Njoro]], Kenya and in 1999 from [[Pomacle]], France. It is noteworthy that the only other Irish World Champion (apart from first winner, Charlie Keegan) was Eamonn Tracey, winning in [[Saint Jean D'Illac]], France in 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://worldploughing.org/?page_id=369|title = Champions of the World Ploughing Contests since 1953.|date = |access-date = |website = |publisher = World Ploughing Organisation|last = |first = }}</ref> Milestones in their illustrious history were recorded in Independent Newspapers in 2011.<ref name="independent.ie">{{Cite web|url = http://www.independent.ie/business/farming/ploughing-championships/milestones-in-the-history-of-the-national-ploughing-championships-26773612.html|title = Milestones in the history of the National ploughing championships|date = |access-date = |website = Business: Ploughing Championships|publisher = Independent Newspapers|last = |first = }}</ref>
Together with her 32-member board of directors team, she has steered NPA into becoming one of the largest outdoor annual events in Europe.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://insideireland.ie/2014/09/24/europes-largest-outdoor-exhibition-and-agricultural-trade-show-the-national-ploughing-championships-takes-place-from-23-25th-september-107058/|title = Irish Business, News and Lifestyle|date = |access-date = |website = Europe’s largest Outdoor Exhibition and Agricultural Trade Show, the National Ploughing Championships finishes on Thursday|publisher = InsideIreland.ie|last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150216153128/http://insideireland.ie/2014/09/24/europes-largest-outdoor-exhibition-and-agricultural-trade-show-the-national-ploughing-championships-takes-place-from-23-25th-september-107058/|archivedate = 16 February 2015|df = dmy-all}}</ref> Among their achievements, NPA records that in 1975 the number of national exhibitors was 100, the number of counties competing was 21 and the number of demonstrators was 18. In 1978 the Championships returned to [[County Kilkenny]] this time to the village where Anna May McHugh's predecessor, Seán O'Farrell, was born, [[Knocktopher]]. Attendance figures grew very steadily throughout the 1970s and 1980s until 1988, when the event was expanded to 3 days in order to cater for heavy traffic due to escalating attendances. According to NPA records, the [[Irish Countrywomen's Association|ICA]] and Country Markets then started giving cookery and craft demonstrations at the shows. Other new events were added with the Fashion Show in 1981; their introduction of Shopping and Business Arcades in 1985 and Kverneland World Class Challenge; the Livestock Section in 1987 and the Nissan Classic in 1989. They record that the "Tented Village" era was developed substantially at the ploughing contests throughout the 1990s and early 2000s. They credit [[Enterprise Ireland]] with bringing delegations from a number of countries to review the event, with exhibitors travelling from Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Poland and the USA.
Between 2000 and 2011 the Ploughing Championships had grown to 180,000 spectators, 320 competitors, 1,100 exhibitors, 14 shopping arcades and was by then generating €10m for the local Irish economy.<ref name="independent.ie"/>
Now in its 84th year NPA records that Event costs are in the region of €3.5 million, and have Ploughing Associations in every county in the country of Ireland.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.npa.ie/county-ploughing-dates/|title = County Ploughing Dates 2014/2015|date = |accessdate = |website = Irish National Ploughing Association|publisher = NPA|last = |first = }}</ref> NPA claims to now hold the biggest National Ploughing Championships in the world, where over 320 competitors participate in the National Finals; to cater for 19 All-Ireland Ploughing Title Classes; are Ireland’s primary Agricultural Exhibition, and hold one of the largest agricultural events in Europe; that many international visitors, exhibitors and delegations from right around Europe and from as far afield as New Zealand now participate; that events have up to 1,100 trade stands which exhibit billions of euro worth of the most modern agri-equipment in the world on exhibition at the Championships.
It is extraordinary that NPA are still a voluntary association that depends on voluntary efforts of their members from all around the country to achieve such goals. With an average of 180,000 spectators, the NPA attendance has grown from the 3,000 that attended in 1932 to over 280,000 in the 2010s.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.npa.ie/2015/09/another-record-breaking-year/|title = Another Record Breaking Year|date = |accessdate = |website = Irish National Ploughing Association|publisher = NPA|last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151005153529/http://www.npa.ie/2015/09/another-record-breaking-year/|archivedate = 5 October 2015|df = dmy-all}}</ref> NPA's National Ploughing Championships (NPC) are a shop window to what Irish people can achieve when working together, and a great credit to spirit of rural Ireland ever since the country gained its independence one century ago.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.breakingnews.ie/ireland/video-take-a-tour-of-the-massive-national-ploughing-championships-site-697059.html|title = Take a tour of the massive National Ploughing Championships site|date =22 September 2015 |accessdate =1 October 2015 |website = BreakingNews.ie|publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>

{{unreferenced|date=January 2009}} The '''Night and Day Concert''' is a [[concert]] performed by [[Elton John]] on June 30, 1984 in the [[Wembley Stadium (1923)|Wembley Stadium]]. It was broadcast live in full on [[BBC Radio 1]], borrowing [[BBC Radio 2|Radio 2]]'s FM stereo frequencies.<ref>[http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/e0729881620d4f70b3be44372b557486 BBC Genome Project - Radio Times listings]</ref>
Promoting John's ''[[Breaking Hearts]]'' album, the concert was videotaped for air on the Showtime cable channel, as well as commercial distribution and released on two [[VHS]] tapes: [[The Afternoon Concert]] ("The Breaking Hearts Tour") and "[[The Night Time Concert]]". Not all songs performed in the concert made it to video.

{{Orphan|date=August 2017}}
'''Qalandiya International''' is a contemporary art event and [[biennale]] that takes place every two years across Palestinian cities and villages. Founded in 2012, it brings together Palestinian and international art and culture organizations in collaboration to produce exhibitions, performances, talks, film screenings, workshops, and tours.
QI coincides with and incorporates The Jerusalem Show, a cultural event organized by the Al-Ma’mal Foundation and centered in the Old City, and the Young Artist of the Year Award (YAYA), organized by the [[A. M. Qattan Foundation]] and given every two years to a Palestinian artist under the age of 30.
== History ==
=== QI 2012 === The inaugural Qalandiya International was conceived as a way to create an infrastructure that supported cultural practice across Palestine and the diaspora. It took place from 1–15 November 2012 under the title ''Art and Life in Palestine'', and was co- produced by the Al-Ma’mal Foundation for Contemporary Art in Jerusalem (which had been producing The Jerusalem Show since 2007), Al Hoash- Palestinian Art Court, the International Academy of Art- Palestine, A. M. Qattan Foundation, Khalil Sakakini Cultural Center, and [[Riwaq (organization)|RIWAQ]] – Center for Architectural Conservation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/11/201211410554507478.html|title=Biennale seeks to boost Palestinian art|last=Hatuqa|first=Dalia|date=4 November 2012|website=Al Jazeera|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
=== QI 2014 === The second edition of Qalandiya International ran from 22 October- 15 November 2014, under the title ''Archives Lived and Shared.'' [[The Palestinian Museum]] was added as a partner and hosted a documentary survey exhibition, called ‘Introduction to Palestinian Museums.’ Other partners included A. M. Qattan Foundation, Arab Cultural Association, Al Hoash- Palestinian Art Court, Al- Mashghal, The International Academy of Art- Palestine, Khalil Sakakini Cultural Center, RIWAQ – Center for Architectural Conservation, Ramallah Municipality, MinRASY Projects, Eltiqa Group, and Windows for Contemporary Art.
One of the main exhibitions, ‘Manam,’ which was organized by the Arab Cultural Association in Haifa, was unable to host many of its Palestinian participants, who were prevented from attending by the Israeli- imposed system of permits, roadblocks, and checkpoints.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Gray|first=Nicola|date=2015|title=Qalandiya International I and II: Cultural Resistance in a Palestinian Biennale|url=|journal=Third Text|volume= 29| issue = 3|pages=165–183|via=}}</ref>
=== QI 2016 === The third and latest edition of Qalandiya International took place from 5–30 October 2016 under the title ''This Sea is Mine.'' Addressing themes of exile and return, the program launched with 15 exhibition openings and 80 events, taking place in Haifa, Gaza, Jerusalem, Ramallah and Al-Bireh, Bethlehem, Beirut, Amman, and London. Participating organizations included A. M. Qattan Foundation, Al Hoash – Palestinian Art Court, Al Ma'mal Foundation for Contemporary Art, Arab Culture Association, Dar Al Kalima, Dar El Nimer, Darat Al Funun, Eltiqa Group, International Academy of Art – Palestine, Khalil Sakakini Cultural Center, MinRASY Projects, Palestine Regeneration Group (PART), Ramallah Municipality, RIWAQ – Center for Architectural Conservation, Shababek for Contemporary Art, and The Palestinian Museum. Programs extended across a patchwork of venues, including, in addition to QI’s main partners, the Palestinian Child Centre & Youth Activities Centre in Shu’fat Refugee Camp (Jerusalem), Dheisheh Refugee Camp (Bethlehem), Ramallah Recreational Complex, Birzeit University, the Palestinian National Garden, and others. Programs included ‘O Whale, Don’t Swallow Our Moon,’ a solo exhibition for artist [[Jumana Emil Abboud]] at the Khalil Sakakini Cultural Center in Ramallah.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://news.artnet.com/exhibitions/qalandiya-international-biennial-palestine-686522|title=Qalandiya International: A Multi- City Palestinian Biennial for a Fragmented Territory|last=Buffenstein|first=Alyssa|date=7 October 2016|website=Artnet|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://brooklynrail.org/2016/12/artseen/reflections-on-the-sea-is-mine-2016-qalandiya-international-in-palestine|title=Reflections on The Sea is Mine: 2016 Qalandiya International in Palestine|last=Reichert|first=Elliot J.|date=6 December 2016|website=The Brooklyn Rail|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> An online full exhibition catalogue for QI2016: ''This Sea is Mine'' was published by [[Ibraaz]] in October 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ibraaz.org/publications/79|title=Qalandiya International 2016: This Sea is Mine|website=Ibraaz|access-date=2017-11-03}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox military person |honorific_prefix=[[Major]] |name=Sandeep Unnikrishnan |honorific_suffix=[[Ashok Chakra Award|AC]] |image=Sandeep Unnikrishnan.jpg |image_size= |birth_date={{Birth date|1977|3|15|df=yes}} |death_date={{Death date and age|2008|11|28|1977|3|17|df=yes}} |birth_place=[[Kozhikode]], [[Kerala]], India |death_place= [[Mumbai]], [[Maharashtra]], India |placeofburial_label=Cremationhttp://www.oneindia.com/2008/11/29/maj-sandip-unnikrishnan-cremated-1227949427.html |placeofburial= [[Hebbal]], [[Bangalore]], [[Karnataka]] |allegiance= {{flagicon|India}} [[India]] |branch=[[File:Flag of Indian Army.svg|24px]] [[Indian Army]] |unit=[[51 Special Action Group|51 SAG, NSG]]
[[Bihar Regiment|7 BIHAR]] |battles= [[Operation Vijay (1999)|Operation Vijay]]
[[Insurgency in Kashmir|Counter-Insurgency]]
[[2008 Mumbai attacks|Operation Black Tornado]] |serviceyears=1999–2008 |rank=[[File:Major of the Indian Army.svg|25px]][[Major]] |awards= [[File:Ashoka Chakra ribbon.svg|34px]][[Ashoka Chakra Award|Ashoka Chakra]] | servicenumber= IC-58660 }} '''Sandeep Unnikrishnan''' (15 March 1977 – 28 November 2008) was an officer in the [[Indian Army]] serving in the elite [[51 Special Action Group|Special Action Group]] of the [[National Security Guards]]. He was martyred in action during the [[November 2008 Mumbai attacks]].{{cite news|publisher = PTI|title = 2 NSG men killed, six others injured in Mumbai gunbattles|url = http://www.ptinews.com/pti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/FFB1157E6E7B9C4F6525750F004376C9?OpenDocument|date = 28 November|accessdate = 2008-11-28}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} He was consequently awarded the [[Ashoka Chakra Award|Ashoka Chakra]], India's highest peace time gallantry award, on 26 January 2009.{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/11-security-personnel-to-get-ashok-chakra/83597-3.html|title=11 security personnel to get Ashok Chakra|accessdate=2009-01-25}} ==Early and personal life== Sandeep Unnikrishnan came from a [[Malayali]] family residing in [[Bangalore]], where they had moved from [[Cheruvannur]], [[Kozhikode district|Kozhikode District]] in the state of [[Kerala]].{{cite news|publisher = WebIndia 123|title = Army Major from Kerala dies in Mumbai encounter|url = http://news.webindia123.com/news/articles/India/20081128/1115900.html|date = 28 November 2008|accessdate =28 November 2008}} He was the only son of retired [[ISRO]] officer K. Unnikrishnan and Dhanalakshmi Unnikrishnan.{{cite news| url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1081129/jsp/nation/story_10182139.jsp | location=Calcutta, India | work=The Telegraph | title=Boy who had a crew cut in school | date=2008-11-29}} Unnikrishnan spent 14 years at the Frank Anthony Public School in Bangalore before graduating in 1995 in the [[Indian School Certificate|ISC]] Science stream.{{clarify|date=November 2014}} He wanted to join the Army, even attending school in a [[crew cut]]. His peers and teachers recalled him as being a good athlete who was active in school activities and sports events.{{cite news |agency=Times of India |url = http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-11-29/bangalore/27943762_1_major-unnikrishnan-major-sandeep-c-browne |title=A school remembers |publisher=TOI |date=2008-11-29 |accessdate=2008-11-29}} He was also a member of the school choir and enjoyed watching movies.{{cite news |agency=India Today|url = http://indiatoday.digitaltoday.in/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=21369§ionid=4&issueid=82&Itemid=1 |title=Sandeep Unnikrishnan: A movie maniac |publisher=India Today |date=2008-11-30 |accessdate=2008-11-30}} ==Army career== Unnikrishnan joined the [[National Defence Academy (India)]] (NDA), [[Pune]], [[Maharashtra]] in 1995. He was a part of the Oscar Squadron (No. 4 Battalion) and a graduate of the 94th Course of NDA. He graduated as a [[Bachelor of Arts]]. His NDA friends remember him as "selfless", "generous" and "calm and composed".{{cite news |agency=The Times Of India |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-11-30/india/27910740_1_nsg-buddies-sandeep-unnikrishnan |title=NDA Buddies Remember Unni=The Times Of India |date=2008-11-30 |accessdate=2008-11-30 |first1=Prasenjit |last1=Mund}} He was commissioned as a [[lieutenant]] to the 7th Battalion of the [[Bihar Regiment]] (Infantry) on 12 July 1999. After serving the Indian Army in different locations in [[Jammu and Kashmir]] and [[Rajasthan]] during counter insurgencies for two terms, he was selected to join the [[National Security Guards]]. On completion of training, he was assigned to the Special Action Group (SAG) of NSG on January 2007 and participated in various operations of the NSG.[http://mangalorean.com/news.php?newstype=broadcast&broadcastid=102951 Mangalorean.Com- Serving Mangaloreans Around The World!] During the 'Ghatak course' (at the Commando Wing (Infantry School), Belgaum), the most difficult course of the Army, Unnikrishnan topped the course, earning an "Instructor Grading" and commendation. He opted for the NSG commando service which he joined on deputation in 2006.{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-11-29/patna/27911835_1_major-unnikrishnan-nsg-commando-maj-unnikrishnan | work=The Times Of India | first1=Kumod | last1=Verma | title=Bihar Regiment fondly remembers Major Unnikrishnan | date=2008-11-29}} During [[Operation Vijay (1999)|Operation Vijay]] in July 1999, he was regarded positively at the forward posts in the face of heavy artillery firing and small arms fire by Pakistan troops. On the evening of 31 December 1999,{{Clarify|date=November 2014}} Unnikrishnan led a team of six soldiers and managed to establish a post 200 metres from the opposing side and under direct observation and fire.{{cite news| url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200812101678.htm | location=Chennai, India | work=The Hindu | title=Major Unnikrishnan's colleagues recall his qualities | date=2008-12-10}} ===Operation Black Tornado=== On the night of 26 November 2008, several iconic [[2008 Mumbai attacks|buildings in South Mumbai were attacked]]. One of the buildings where hostage were held was the 100-year-old [[Taj Mahal Palace & Tower|Taj Mahal Palace Hotel]]. Unnikrishnan was the team commander of [[51 Special Action Group]] (51 SAG) deployed in the operation at the hotel to rescue the hostages. He entered the hotel in a group of 10 commandos and reached the sixth floor through the staircase. As the team descended the stairs, they suspected perpetrators on the third floor. A few women were held as hostages in a room which was locked from the inside. After breaking open the door, the round of fire by the perpetrators hit Commando Sunil Yadav, who was Unnikrishnan's colleague.[http://sify.com/news/fullstory.php?id=14809318 A buddy called Major Unnikrishnan] Unnikrishan engaged the perpetrators in a firefight. He arranged for Yadav's evacuation and gave chase to those he had engaged in the firefight who, meanwhile, escaped to another floor of the hotel.[http://sify.com/news/fullstory.php?id=14809318 sify.com] In the encounter that followed, he was shot from the back before later succumbing to his injuries.{{cite news|publisher = The Hindu|title = Sandeep Unnikrishnan waged a valiant battle against terrorists|url = http://www.hindu.com/2008/11/29/stories/2008112959030900.htm|date = 29 November 2008|accessdate =29 November 2008|location=Chennai, India}}[http://ibnlive.in.com/news/nation-bids-adieu-to-ats-chief-nsg-commando/79337-3.html Nation bids adieu to ATS chief, NSG commando – India News – IBNLive]{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Bangalore/Maj_Sandeep_UnniKrishnan_-_A_school_remembers/articleshow/3770767.cms | work=The Times Of India | title=Maj Sandeep UnniKrishnan – A school remembers | date=2008-11-29}} His last words were, "Do not come up, I will handle them," according to NSG officials.{{cite news |agency=The Hindu |url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/11/30/stories/2008113060690800.htm |title=Hero's last words — The Hindu |date=2008-11-30 |accessdate=2008-11-30 |location=Chennai, India}} ====Ashoka Chakra citation==== The official citation for the [[Ashoka Chakra Award]] reads:{{Quotation|
'''IC-58660 MAJOR SANDEEP UNNIKRISHNAN BIHAR REGIMENT/51 SPECIAL ACTION GROUP (POSTHUMOUS)'''
Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan led the commando operation launched on 27th November 2008 to flush out terrorists from Hotel Taj Mahal, Mumbai in which he rescued 14 hostages.
During the operation, his team came under intense hostile fire, in which one of his team members got grievously injured. Major Sandeep pinned down the terrorists with accurate fire and rescued the injured commando to safety. In the process, he was shot in his right arm. Despite his injuries, he continued to fight the terrorists till his last breath.
Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan displayed most conspicuous bravery besides camaraderie and leadership of the highest order and made the supreme sacrifice for the nation.{{citation|url=http://pib.nic.in/newsite/erelease.aspx?relid=46980|accessdate=14 September 2014|date=25 January 2009|title=Ashoka Chakra awardees and their saga of gallantry |publisher=Press Information Bureau, Government of India}}}} ==Funeral== At Unnikrishnan's funeral, mourners chanted "Sandeep Unnikrishnan Amar Rahe" (Long live Sandeep Unnikrishnan).{{cite news |agency=The Hindu |url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200811291431.htm |title=Hundreds pay tributes to slain NSG major in Bangalore — The Hindu |date=2008-11-29 |accessdate=2008-12-03 |location=Chennai, India}} Thousands of people lined up outside his Bangalore house to pay their respects. His funeral was held with full military honours.{{cite news|last1=Ravindran|first1=Nirmala|title=Nation bid tearful adieu to Karkare, Unnikrishnan|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/Nation+bid+tearful+adieu+to+Karkare,+Unnikrishnan/1/21274.html|accessdate=24 January 2015|publisher=India Today|date=29 Nov 2008}}{{cite web|title=Home They Brought Her Warrior Dead: The Day Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan Died|url=http://topyaps.com/home-brought-warrior-dead-day-major-sandeep-unnikrishnan-died|website=http://topyaps.com/|accessdate=24 January 2015}} The Mother Dairy Double Road in Bangalore, a 4.5 km road from Federal Mogul on Doddaballapur Road to MS Palya junction, was renamed Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan Road in his honour. A bust of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan is installed on Ramamurthy Nagar Outer Ring Road junction in Bengaluru and is named in his honour. {{cite web|title=Teachers’ Colony pays tribute, names park after Sandeep Unnikrishnan - Bangalore Mirror -|url=http://bangaloremirror.indiatimes.com/bangalore/others/Teachers-Colony-pays-tribute-names-park-after-Sandeep-Unnikrishnan/articleshow/50523731.cms|website=Bangalore Mirror|accessdate=28 September 2017}} ==See also== {{Contains Indic text}} * [[Havaldar Gajender Singh]] * [[Ashok Kamte]] * [[Hemant Karkare]] * [[Vijay Salaskar]] * [[Tukaram Omble]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090301040945/http://www.sandeepunnikrishnan.org/ Official Website] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Unnikrishnan, Sandeep}} [[Category:Indian military personnel killed in action]] [[Category:Military personnel from Bangalore]] [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:People associated with the 2008 Mumbai attacks]] [[Category:Victims of the 2008 Mumbai attacks]] [[Category:Recipients of the Ashoka Chakra (military decoration)]] [[Category:People from Kozhikode]] [[Category:Malayali people]] [[Category:Military personnel from Kerala]]

'''Sarah Wilson''' (1754? – 1865?) was an [[England|English]] [[impostor]] who took a role of nonexistent sister of [[Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz|Queen Charlotte]]. How much of the tale is true is unclear.
Sarah Wilson was born in [[Staffordshire]] and at the age of 16 moved to [[London]]. According to the usual tale, within a week she became a maidservant to Caroline Vernon, [[lady-in-waiting]] for Queen Charlotte, and was acquainted with the relations and rumours of the court.
Around 1771 Wilson was working in the "Queen's House" (in the place where [[Buckingham Palace]] is now). She began to steal the jewellery and clothing of the queen. She was apprehended and first condemned to death but eventually the sentence was commuted to [[penal transportation]] to the American colonies. In July 1771, Wilson arrived to [[Baltimore, Maryland]] and was sold to W. Devall as an [[indenture]]d servant. A few days later she escaped.
According to the tale, Wilson still had some of the queen's belongings with her. With the queen's dress, she took the role of "Princess Susanna Caroline Matilda of [[House of Mecklenburg|Mecklenburg-Strelitz]]", fictitious sister of Queen Charlotte. She claimed that she had had a disagreement with her family and due to the scandal had moved to America. She fooled a number of [[Virginia]]n landowners with her courtly habits and knowledge of royal affairs. When some local colonials accepted her as genuine, others began to question why no one had ever heard of the queen's sister. The Queen was originally from Germany and this princess spoke only English.
Eventually Devall heard about a woman who looked very much like the girl who had escaped. In 1771 he spread a notice that 'Princess Susanna' was his slave and sent her hireling Michael Dalton to get her back. Dalton found her near [[Charlestown, Virginia]] and dragged her back to Bush Creek.
For two years Wilson worked for Devall, until he joined the rebels at the beginning of the [[American War of Independence]]. Wilson fled and later married [[dragoon]] officer William Talbot. After the war they stayed in the newly formed [[United States of America]].
There is no record of when Sarah Wilson died. Author [[Egon Larsen]] suggested that she died in Bristol in 1865.<ref>Larsen, Egon. (1966) ''The Deceivers: Lives of the Great Impostors''. John Baker Publishers Ltd. p. 70</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}} * Sarah Burton - ''Impostors'' (Penguin Books 2000, pages 49–51)
==External links== *[http://www.mysteriouspeople.com/princess_hoax.htm Sarah Wilson - Princess Hoax]

{{Use British English|date=July 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox official post | post = Secretary | body = State for Exiting the European Union | insignia = Royal Coat of Arms of the United Kingdom (HM Government).svg | image = Official portrait of Stephen Barclay crop 2.jpg | insigniacaption = [[Royal coat of arms of the United Kingdom|Royal Arms]] of [[Her Majesty's Government]] | incumbent = [[Stephen Barclay]] | incumbentsince = 16 November 2018 | department = [[Department for Exiting the European Union]] | style = Brexit Secretary
{{small|(informal)}}
[[The Right Honourable]]
{{small|(within the UK and the Commonwealth)}} | member_of = [[Cabinet of the United Kingdom|Cabinet]] | reports_to = [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] | seat = [[Westminster]], [[London]] | appointer = The [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|Monarch]] | appointer_qualified = on advice of the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] | termlength = [[At Her Majesty's pleasure]] | first = [[David Davis (British politician)|David Davis]] | formation = 13 July 2016 | website = }} {{Politics of the United Kingdom}} {{Brexit}} '''Her Majesty's Principal Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union''' or, informally, '''Brexit Secretary''',{{cite news | url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/brexit-secretary-david-davis-we-will-quit-the-eu-in-december-2018-a3295716.html | title=Brexit Secretary David Davis says UK 'will quit the EU in December 2018' | work=[[Evening Standard]] | date=14 July 2016 | accessdate=14 July 2016 | author=Cecil, Nicholas}} is the [[Secretary of State (United Kingdom)|Secretary of State]] responsible for the [[United Kingdom]]'s withdrawal from the [[European Union]], informally referred to as "[[Brexit]]". The secretary will oversee withdrawal negotiations following a [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|nationwide referendum on 23 June 2016]], in which a majority voted in favour of exiting the EU.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-britain-eu-davis-idUKKCN0ZT2IH |title='Charming Bastard' David Davis to lead Brexit talks|work=[[Reuters]]|authors= James, William; Holden, Michael|date=13 July 2016|access-date=9 July 2018}}.{{cite news|author=Foster, Matt|url=https://www.civilserviceworld.com/articles/news/new-department-business-energy-and-industrial-strategy-swallows-decc-and-bis-%E2%80%94-full|title= New Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy swallows up DECC and BIS — full details and reaction|work= Civil Service World|date=14 July 2016|access-date=9 July 2018}} The office-holder is a member of the [[Cabinet of the United Kingdom|Cabinet]]. The position was created at the outset of the [[First May ministry|premiership]] of [[Theresa May]], who became [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] on 13 July 2016.{{Cite press release|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-ministerial-appointment-july-2016-secretary-of-state-for-exiting-the-european-union|title=New ministerial appointment July 2016: Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union|date=13 July 2016|publisher=Prime Minister's Office, [[10 Downing Street]]|access-date= 9 July 2018}} May reportedly ordered civil servants to find a building to house a new [[Department for Exiting the European Union]], to be headed by the Secretary of State.{{cite news|author=Taylor, Adam|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/07/14/david-davis-the-man-in-charge-of-getting-britain-out-of-the-e-u/ |title=David Davis: The man in charge of getting Britain out of the E.U.|work= [[Washington Post]]|date=14 July 2016|access-date= 9 July 2018}} The headquarters of the [[Department of Energy and Climate Change]] (DECC) at Whitehall Place, which was to be vacated once the DECC was merged into the newly created [[Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy]], was viewed as a potential site for the department. The department now occupies [[9 Downing Street]]. The inaugural holder was [[David Davis (British politician)|David Davis]] MP, a longtime [[Euroscepticism in the United Kingdom|Eurosceptic]] who campaigned for the UK to leave the EU.{{cite news|author= Crace, John|url= https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/feb/04/david-davis-spells-out-his-eu-strategy-be-more-like-canada|title= David Davis spells out his EU strategy: be more like Canada|work= [[The Guardian]]|date= 4 February 2016|access-date= 9 July 2018}} Davis is a former [[chairman of the Conservative Party]] who served in the [[Second Major ministry|government of John Major]] as [[Minister of State for Europe]] (1994–97) and in the [[Shadow Cabinet of David Cameron]] as [[shadow home secretary|Shadow Home Secretary]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-36785814|title= Theresa May's cabinet: Who's in and who's out?|work=[[BBC News]]|date=13 July 2016|access-date= 9 July 2018}} Davis resigned on 8 July 2018 shortly before midnight; [[Dominic Raab]] was appointed on 9 July as his replacement and resigned on 15 November 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-46219495|title=Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab resigns over EU agreement|last=|first=|work=[[BBC News]]| date= 15 November 2018|access-date=15 November 2018}} [[Stephen Barclay]], who had been serving as [[Minister of State for Health]], was selected as Raab's successor on the 16 November 2018.{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-46241693 |title=Steve Barclay named new Brexit Secretary |date=16 November 2018 |work=[[BBC News]] |access-date=16 November 2018}} ==List of Secretaries of State for Exiting the European Union== '''Colour key''' (for political parties):

({{lang-en|Selena Lives!}}) was a [[benefit concert]] which was held on the tenth anniversary of the death of [[Tejano music|Tejano]] superstar [[Selena|Selena Quintanilla-Pérez]]. The concert was held on April 7, 2005 at the [[Reliant Stadium]] in [[Houston]], Texas with over 70,000 attendees. The special was produced and filmed by the Spanish language network, [[Univision]], and is the most watched Spanish-language special in U.S. history. ==Concert synopsis== The special opened with an introduction by [[Jennifer Lopez]], followed by Selena's original greeting to the fans of her last concert at the [[Houston Astrodome]] on February 26, 1995. The musical tribute also included a performance by Mexican singer [[Thalía]]'s interpretation of one of Selena's songs, "[[Amor Prohibido (song)|Amor Prohibido]]." Thalía's performance was followed by many Latin singers, all performing a collection of Selena's songs. The group [[Banda el Recodo]] performed a rendition of "[[Techno Cumbia]]." [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rican]] [[Salsa music|salsa]] group [[La India|India]] performed "[[No Debes Jugar]]." After a short video recounting Selena's discovery, Mexican recording artist [[Ana Bárbara]] performed "[[La Carcacha]]" along with a full complement of dancers. The duet "[[Buenos Amigos]]" was then performed by newcomer [[Mariana Seoane]] and [[Pablo Montero]]. Singer [[Alicia Villarreal]] ended the segment with "[[Si Una Vez]]". Following another video recalling Selena's international success, Mexican singer [[Ana Gabriel]] dedicated her performance of Selena's "[[Tú, Sólo Tú]]" to her memory. She then introduced [[Pepe Aguilar]], who dedicated his rendition of "[[No Me Queda Más]]." After a video depicting Selena's origins in Texas, the song "[[Fotos Y Recuerdos]]" by [[Paulina Rubio]] was performed. The next video segment showed Selena's back-up band, Los Dinos, and was narrated by one of its former members, [[Pete Astudillo]]. Astudillo then performed the song he wrote after her death, "Cómo Te Extraño." After a video montage covering Selena's life, [[Puerto Rico]]'s [[Olga Tañón]] performed the song "[[La Llamada]]." Singer [[Gloria Estefan]] performed Selena's English language hit "[[I Could Fall in Love]]." Selena's brother [[A.B. Quintanilla]] and his group, [[Kumbia Kings]], performed a duet with his sister in a specially remixed version of her hit "[[Baila Esta Cumbia]]". Later, Mexican singer [[Alejandra Guzmán]] performed Selena's song "[[Bidi Bidi Bom Bom]]". This was followed by a [[Tex-Mex]] medley by [[Bobby Pulido]] and Jay Pérez. The late [[Colombia]]n singer/songwriter [[Soraya (musician)|Soraya]] performed "[[Dreaming of You (Selena song)|Dreaming of You]]" and was joined on stage by the vocal group Barrio Boyzz. Mexican singer [[Graciela Beltrán]] performed the song "[[El Chico Del Apartamento 512]]." A video of Selena's legacy was then followed by [[Aleks Syntek]] and [[Fey (singer)|Fey]] performing "[[Donde Quiera Que Estés]]." The band, Montéz de Durango performed an arrangement of "[[Ven Conmigo (album)|Ven Conmigo]]." At the end of the concert, a video of Selena, performing "[[Como La Flor (song)|Como La Flor]]" played on giant video screens accompanied by Los Dinos, while all the performers returned to the stage to sing the chorus along with a 55-member children's choir from Stevenson Elementary. ==Achievements== ''Selena ¡VIVE!'' also went on to achieve a record breaking 35.9 household rating to become the highest rated and most viewed Spanish-language TV special in the history of [[American television]]. The special was also the number one program regardless of language among adults 18-34 in Los Angeles, Chicago, and San Francisco while tying for first place in New York, beating that night's episode of [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]'s ''[[American Idol]]'', which has historically received high viewer ship due to its popularity. ==Setlist== # Amor Prohibido - Thalía # Techno Cumbia - Banda El Recodo # No Debes Jugar - India # La Carcacha - Ana Bárbara # Buenos Amigos - Mariana Seoane & Pablo Montero # Si Una Vez - Alicia Villarreal # Tú, Sólo Tú - Ana Gabriel # No Me Queda Mas - Pepe Aguilar # Fotos Y Recuerdos - Paulina Rubio # Cómo Te Extraño - Pete Astudillo # La Llamada - Olga Tañón # I Could Fall in Love - Gloria Estefan # Baila Esta Cumbia - A.B. Quintanilla y los Kumbia Kings with Selena # Bidi Bidi Bom Bom - Alejandra Guzman # Ya Ves/Yo Te Sigo Queriendo - Bobby Pulido & Jay Pérez # Dreaming of You - Soraya & Barrio Boyzz # El Chico Del Apartmento 512 - Graciela Beltrán # Donde Quiera Que Estés - Aleks Syntek and Fey # Ven Conmigo - Montéz de Durango # Como La Flor - Selena y los Dinos, Cast & 55-member children's choir ==Album== {{Infobox album | name = Selena ¡VIVE! | type = Live | artist = Various artists | cover = SelenaiVive!Album.jpg | alt = | released = May 10, 2005 (U.S.) | recorded = 2004 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Tejano music|Tejano]]/[[Latin pop]] | length = | label = [[EMI Latin|EMI]] | producer = [[A.B. Quintanilla]] | prev_title = [[Unforgettable (Selena album)|Unforgettable]] | prev_year = 2005 | next_title = [[Dos Historias]] | next_year = 2006 }} The tribute concert was followed up with the release of the album of the performance, released on May 10, 2005. Though it did not include many of the songs performed, it does include many of the highlights. ===Track listing=== # "[[Tú Sólo Tú]]" - Ana Gabriel # "[[Amor Prohibido]]" - [[Thalía]] # "[[El Chico Del Apartamento 512]]" - [[Lucero (actress)|Lucero]] # "[[I Could Fall in Love]]" - Gloria Estefan # "[[La Carcacha]]" - [[Ana Bárbara]] # "Cómo Te Extraño" - [[Pete Astudillo]] # "[[Donde Quiera Que Estés]]" - Aleks Syntek/Fey # "[[Si Una Vez]]" - Alicia Villareal # "[[Bidi Bidi Bom Bom]]" - Alejandra Guzmán # "[[No Debes Jugar]]" - India # "[[Dreaming of You (Selena song)|Dreaming of You]]" - Soraya/The Barrio Boyzz # "[[Como La Flor (song)|Como La Flor]]" - Selena == External links == * {{IMDb title|0465599|Selena ¡VIVE!}} {{Selena}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Selena Vive}} [[Category:Selena]] [[Category:Tribute albums]] [[Category:Tribute concerts in the United States]] [[Category:Music television specials]] [[Category:Music of Houston]] [[Category:2005 live albums]] [[Category:2005 in music]] [[Category:Benefit concerts in the United States]] [[Category:April 2005 events]]

Updated January 2010) [http://www.shangri-la.com/en/corporate/press/pressrelease/24904 ''Press Release: Shangri-La At The Fort, Manila Will Open In 2014 In Fast-Emerging Fort Bonifacio'']{{cite web|title=Shangri-La at the Fort, Manila|url=http://www.shangri-la.com/manila/shangrilaatthefort/press-room/fast-facts/meetings-and-banquet-rooms/?lightbox=1|publisher=Shangri-La Hotels & Resorts|accessdate=21 February 2018}}{{cite web|title=Shangri-La at the Fort|url=http://legacy.skyscrapercenter.com/taguig-city/shangrila-at-the-fort/9233/|website=CTBUH Skyscraper Database|publisher=Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat|accessdate=21 February 2018}} }} '''Shangri-La at the Fort''' is a 5-star luxury hotel and mixed-used building in [[Bonifacio Global City]], [[Taguig]], [[Metro Manila]], [[Philippines]]. It opened on March 1, 2016 and one of the three hotels managed by [[Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts]] located in [[Metro Manila]], Philippines. It also hosts residential units. At {{convert|229.3|m|ft|abbr=on}} tall, it is one of the [[List of tallest buildings in Metro Manila|tallest skyscrapers]] in the Philippines. {{TOC limit|2}} ==Architecture and design== US-based [[Handel Architects]] is the design architect of the Shangri-La at the Fort while GF & Partners Architects Co. is the [[architect of record]]. Manny Samson & Associates were the interior designers of the building.{{cite news|last1=Mangawang|first1=Cesar|title=Shangri-La at The Fort an entire lifestyle complex|url=http://business.inquirer.net/193141/shangri-la-at-the-fort-an-entire-lifestyle-complex|accessdate=21 February 2018|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=6 June 2015}} ==Construction== The [[groundbreaking]] for the building took place on July 3, 2008 in a ceremony led by then-Philippine President [[Gloria Macapagal Arroyo]],{{cite web|title=Speech of President Arroyo at the Groundbreaking Ceremonies of Shangri-La Hotel|url=http://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/2008/07/03/speech-of-president-arroyo-at-the-groundbreaking-ceremonies-of-shangri-la-hotel/|website=Official Gazette of the Republic of the Philippines|accessdate=21 February 2018|date=3 July 2008}} though construction began in 2011. The hotel had a soft-opening on March 1, 2016.{{cite news|last1=Arnaldo|first1=Ma. Stella|title=Shangri-La at The Fort opens its doors|url=https://businessmirror.com.ph/shangri-la-at-the-fort-opens-its-doors/|accessdate=21 February 2018|work=BusinessMirror|date=1 March 2016}} ==Facilities== ===Hotel=== The Shangri-La Hotel at the Fort hosts 576 rooms and suites as of August 2017 with each room at least {{convert|45|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} big.{{cite news|last1=Samaniego|first1=Theresa|title=Destinations for the weekend|url=http://business.inquirer.net/235434/destinations-for-the-weekend|accessdate=21 February 2018|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=19 August 2017}} ===Residential=== The building has two designated residential areas namely Horizon Homes and Shangri-La Residences. The 98-unit Horizon Homes occupies the upper levels of the tower. 97 units ranging from {{convert|90|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} to {{convert|239|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} are allocated for Shangri-La Residence. ===Other=== Two levels occupying an area of {{convert|8000|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} of the Shangri-La at the Fort building is dedicated to Kerry Sports Manila., a sports and leisure area that host indoor courts for basketball, tennis, and squash, as well as a lap pool, gymnasium, exercise studio and a spa facility. For events the building has two events hall; a pillar-less {{convert|1800|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} Grand Ball Room which can accommodate 1,800 people and the {{convert|780|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}} Bonifacio Hall which can hold 715 people. 19 multi function rooms are also spread across the building's several floors. The Adventure Zone is a multi-level children's playground. The building also hosts seven main dining outlets namely: High Street Café, High Street Lounge, Canton Road, Raging Bull Chophouse & Bar, Samba Poolside and Limitless. {{convert|6000|sqm|sqft|abbr=on}}, concentrated mostly on the building's ground floor is dedicated to retail.{{cite news|last1=Olchondra|first1=Riza|title=Horizon Homes lies at the heart of Shangri-La|url=http://business.inquirer.net/190034/horizon-homes-lies-at-the-heart-of-shangri-la|accessdate=21 February 2018|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=12 April 2015}} ==Animal welfare controversy== On February 14, 2018, news spread online that Shangri-la had contacted Pestbusters, a pest control company, to disperse a well established [[cat colony]] at a nearby park because they allegedly ruined the aesthetics of the establishment. The actual numbers vary but it's been reported that at least 20, possibly up to 38 cats, that had been neutered and vaccinated by community volunteers were reported missing. Outraged netizens and animal-lovers immediately started leaving angry comments and emails to the management, and posting negative reviews. The establishment released a statement on their social media account saying that the half of the cats were adopted by its employees while the rest were claimed to have been relocated to two unspecified locations in Taguig.{{Cite web|url=http://www.wheninmanila.com/what-happened-to-the-cats-of-bgc/|title=What happened to the Cats of BGC? {{!}} When In Manila|website=www.wheninmanila.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-18}}{{Cite news|url=http://dailysnout.com/2018/02/18/heres-what-we-know-about-the-cats-relocated-from-shangri-la-at-the-fort/|title=Here's what we know about the cats 'relocated' from Shangri-La at the Fort|date=2018-02-18|work=Daily Snout|access-date=2018-02-18|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/969674/loss-of-taguig-park-cats-sparks-outcry|title=Loss of Taguig park cats sparks outcry|last=Reysio-Cruz|first=Matthew|access-date=2018-02-19|language=en}} The Compassion and Responsibility for Animals Welfare Philippines condemned the act saying that the hotel management was ignorant of the Philippine Animal Welfare Act and that Pestbusters violated Republic Act No. 8485 and accused the pest control firm of being motivated by "greed of money". ==See also== *[[List of tallest buildings in Metro Manila]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Bonifacio Global City}} {{Manila Skyscrapers}} {{Manila hotels}} {{Shangri-La Hotels}} {{coord missing|Philippines}} [[Category:Skyscrapers in Bonifacio Global City]] [[Category:Residential skyscrapers in Metro Manila]] [[Category:Hotels in Metro Manila]] [[Category:Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts]] [[Category:Residential buildings completed in 2016]] [[Category:Hotel buildings completed in 2016]] [[Category:Skyscraper hotels in the Philippines]] [[Category:Animal cruelty incidents]]

{{infobox music festival | | music_festival_name = Smukfest | image = FestiWalther.jpg | caption = FestiWalther the [[mascot]] of Skanderborg Festival. | location = [[Skanderborg]], [[Denmark]] | years_active= 1980 - present | dates = 7 days in August | genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]], [[Pop music|pop]], [[Electronic music|electronic]], [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[blues]] and [[Folk music|folk]]. | attendance = 50,000+ | website = [http://www.smukfest.dk Smukfest] }} '''Smukfest''' (aka '''Skanderborg Festival''') is an annual [[music festival]], held during the first weekend of August in [[Denmark]]. Its location, in a [[beech]] forest in the vicinity of [[Skanderborg]], has given rise to the [[slogan]] "Denmarks' Most Beautiful Festival" (Danish: ''Danmarks Smukkeste Festival'').
The festival covers many styles of music, such as [[rock music|rock]], [[pop music|pop]], [[folk music|folk]], [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]], [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]] and [[electronic music|electronic]]. The festival focuses mainly on Danish music, but with some big names from other countries e.g. [[Britney Spears]], [[Eric Clapton]], [[Prince (musician)|Prince]], [[Pet Shop Boys]], [[Ozzy Osbourne]], [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]], [[Fat Boy Slim]], [[Blood Hound Gang]] and many more.
The first festival was held in 1980, and was a one-day event with 7 bands and about 600 spectators.
The festival has a mascot called "Waltidur Festismuk Kærligkys Ølimund Rockilund Trold" (Waltidur Party-beauty Loving-kiss Beer-in-mouth Rock-in-grove Troll), born in 1579, thus the festival was born on Waltidurs 400th birthday.
In 2009, Skanderborg Festival was held for the 30th time and is today the second largest (sleep-over) festival in Denmark, after the [[Roskilde Festival]]. The festival gathered more than 50,000 people for the concerts, including 8,500 workers, most of them volunteers and has reached the current site's maximum capacity.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://politiken.dk/kultur/musik/skanderborg/ECE2044308/fra-600-til-50000-gaester-smukfest-anklages-for-at-skade-historisk-skov/|title=Fra 600 til 50.000 gæster: Smukfest anklages for at skade historisk skov [from 600 to 50,000 guests: Smukfest accused of damaging historical forest]|author=Maja Lærke Maach|newspaper=Politiken|date=10 August 2013|language=Danish|accessdate=29 December 2014}}</ref>
The festival is getting increasingly popular and all 40.000+ tickets for the 2017 festival was sold in less than 5 hours.
==Stages== The festival has 4 stages (2016): # Bøgescenerne / The Main Stages # P3-teltet ([[DR (broadcaster)|Danish National Radio]] has a station called P3) # Stjerne-scenen (Star Stage) # Sherwood-scenen (Sherwood Stage)
The festival main stage consist of two stages and is called "Bøgescenerne" (Beech stages). [[File:Smukfest, Bøgescenen, 20160804.jpg|1280px]]
==Music performances== <gallery> Image:Gnags, Smukfest, 2016.jpg|Gnags, 2016 Image:Walter Trout and sons, Smukfest 2016.jpg|Walter Trout and sons, 2016 Image:Peter Sommer Smukfest 2013.jpg|[[Peter Sommer]], 2013 Image:Dúné 20130810 (Smukfest).jpeg|Dúné, 2013 Image:Savage Rose - Smukfest 2011.jpg|[[Savage Rose]], 2011 </gallery>

The mission was contracted by [[NASA]] and is flown by [[SpaceX]] using a [[SpaceX Dragon|Dragon]] capsule. This will be the last flight for SpaceX under the first phase of NASA's Commercial Resupply Services. A second phase was awarded in January 2016 and expected to begin in 2019. ==Launch schedule history== On February 2016, it was announced that NASA had awarded a contract extension to SpaceX for five CRS additional missions ([[SpaceX CRS-16|CRS-16]] to CRS-20). A June 2016 NASA Inspector General report had this mission manifested for 2019, but by February 2018 the launch had been pushed back to January 2020.{{cite web |url=http://spaceflight101.com/iss/iss-calendar/ |title=International Space Station Calendar |date=February 24, 2018 |accessdate=February 26, 2018}} ==Primary payload== NASA contracted for the CRS-20 mission from SpaceX and therefore determines the primary payload, date of launch, and [[orbital elements|orbital parameters]] for the [[SpaceX Dragon|Dragon space capsule]]. According to a 2016 presentation, the external payload manifested for this flights is '''GEROS'''. ==See also== *[[List of unmanned spaceflights to the International Space Station]] *[[International Space Station]] – The space station that this mission will resupply. *[[Commercial Resupply Services]] – The [[NASA]] commercial resupply program for the [[ISS]] under which this mission was contracted. *[[SpaceX Dragon|Dragon]] - The spacecraft that performs this mission. *[[Falcon 9]] - The rocket that launches the Dragon capsule. *[[SpaceX]] - The Dragon and Falcon 9 designer, manufacturer and operator. ==References== {{Reflist|30em|refs= {{cite report |author=NASA Office of Inspector General |date=June 28, 2016 |title=NASA’s Response to SpaceX’s June 2015 Launch Failure: Impacts on Commercial Resupply of the International Space Station |url=https://oig.nasa.gov/audits/reports/FY16/IG-16-025.pdf |publisher=NASA Office of Inspector General |format=PDF |issue=Report No. IG-16-025 |page=13 |access-date=2016-07-18}} {{cite web |url=http://spacenews.com/spacex-wins-5-new-space-station-cargo-missions-in-nasa-contract-estimated-at-700-million/ |title=SpaceX wins 5 new space station cargo missions in NASA contract estimated at $700 million |last1=de Selding |first1=Peter B. |publisher=Space News |date=24 February 2016 |accessdate=24 February 2016}} {{cite conference |url=http://www.asi.it/sites/default/files/attach/evento/material_science_workshop_italy_version2.pdf |title=Research Capability of ISS for a Wide Spectrum of Science Disciplines, Including Materials Science |last1=Kenol |first1=Jules |last2=Love |first2=John |conference=Materials in the Space Environment Workshop, Italian Space Agency, Rome |date=May 17, 2016}} }} ==External links== * [http://www.nasa.gov/ NASA] * [http://www.spacex.com/dragon SpaceX official page for the Dragon spacecraft] {{Portalbar|Spaceflight}} {{Dragon spaceflights}} {{Falcon rocket launches}} {{Unmanned ISS resupply flights}} {{Future spaceflights}} {{DEFAULTSORT:CRS 020}} [[Category:Dragon (spacecraft)]] [[Category:2019 in spaceflight]] [[Category:SpaceX payloads contracted by NASA]] [[Category:Supply vehicles for the International Space Station]]

[[File:Paris 2 - Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens -1.JPG|thumb|upright=1|<center>Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens in 2010</center>]] The '''Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens''' ({{IPA-fr|te.atʁ de buf paʁizjɛ̃}}) is a [[Paris]]ian theatre which was founded in 1855 by the [[composer]] [[Jacques Offenbach]] for the performance of [[opéra bouffe]] and [[operetta]]. The current theatre is located in the [[2nd arrondissement of Paris|2nd arrondissement]] at 4 rue Monsigny with an entrance at the back at 65 Passage Choiseul. In the 19th century the theatre was often referred to as the '''Salle Choiseul'''. With the decline in popularity of operetta after 1870, the theatre expanded its repertory to include comedies.<ref name=BPwebsite>[http://www.bouffesparisiens.com/ Bouffes-Parisien website].</ref><ref name=Lamb>Lamb, Andrew. "Offenbach, Jacques" in Sadie 1992, vol. 3, pp. 653–658.</ref><ref name=Levin>Levin 2009, pp. 401–402.</ref><ref>Galignani 1862, [https://books.google.com/books?id=LFsQAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA470 p. 470].</ref><ref>Dickens 1882, p. 32.</ref>
== History == === Salle Lacaze === [[File:Bouffes parisiens.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The public at the Bouffes-Parisiens (ca. 1860)]]
In February 1855 Offenbach successfully requested a license from the Parisian authorities for the performance of what he described as a "new and original" genre of musical theatre. He justified his proposed endeavour by saying that these works would have mass appeal and would provide opportunities for young French composers.<ref name=Levin/>
The company gave its first performances during the summer of 1855 at the [[Salle Lacaze]]. This theatre was unusually small with a capacity of only 300 spectators,<ref>Lamb ( "Offenbach, Jacques" in Sadie 1992, vol. 3, p. 653) gives the capacity of the Salle Lacaze as 300. Gammond (1980, p. 37) says it held an audience of only 50.</ref> but was located on the [[Carré Marigny]], near the crowds attending the [[Exposition Universelle (1855)|Exposition Universelle]]. The inaugural performance was on 5 July with Offenbach conducting four of his own works: a prologue called ''Entrez, messieurs, mesdames'', a one-act ''pièce d'occasion'' written by [[Joseph Méry]] and "Jules Servières" (a [[nom de plume]] of [[Ludovic Halévy]], who worked as a government official and needed to protect his reputation); ''Une nuit blanche'', a one-act ''opéra-comique'' on a pastoral theme; ''Arlequin barbier'', a pantomime utilizing themes from Rossini's ''[[Il barbiere di Siviglia]]'' arranged by "Alfred Lange" (Offenbach); and ''[[Les deux aveugles]]'', a one-act ''bouffonerie musicale'' about two swindling "blind" Parisian beggars. The latter was almost cut, since the invited audience who attended the dress rehearsal failed to laugh, but Offenbach decided to retain it, and it was the hit of the opening night. This little piece soon acquired an international reputation (due to visitors from the Exposition), and Offenbach's admirers soon included [[Tolstoy]] and [[Thackeray]]. Further performances in the summer of 1855 were primarily of satirical sketches which only included a few musical numbers. The season, however, was so successful that Offenbach was able to resign his position as conductor of the [[Théâtre Français]].<ref name=BPwebsite/><ref name=Lamb/><ref>Faris 1980, pp. 51–52.</ref>
=== Salle Choiseul === [[File:Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens interior during 'Le mari à la porte' 1859 - Sadie 1992 3p709.jpg|thumb|upright=1|<center>The Salle Choiseul during a performance of Offenbach's {{Nowrap|''[[Un mari à la porte]]''}} (1859)</center>]] [[File:Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens Paris Illustré 1867 - GB.jpg|thumb|upright=1|<center>Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens {{Nowrap|(ca. 1867)}}</center>]]
In October Offenbach submitted another petition to the authorities, this time to merge his company with the Théâtre des Jeunes Élèves de Monsieur Comte ([[Théâtre Comte]]). This company's theatre, which was not much larger than the Salle Lacaze, was demolished, and the larger Salle Choiseul with a capacity of about 900 was constructed. The new theatre was not only larger, but warmer, more luxurious and more comfortable than the Salle Lacaze. The orchestra was enlarged from sixteen players to thirty.<ref>Lamb ( "Offenbach, Jacques" in Sadie 1992, vol. 3, p. 653) gives the capacity of 900; Faris (1980, pp. 52–53) provides an extensive quote from the periodical ''Le Ménestrel'' describing the demolition and reconstruction of the theatre and the size of the orchestra.</ref> Offenbach's new license permitted performances of one-act comedies, with or without music, but with fewer than five characters. It also specifically excluded sketches and required the performance of at least two works by composers other than Offenbach. The first performance of the merged company was on 29 December 1855 at the Salle Choiseul and included the premiere of Offenbach's ''[[Ba-ta-clan]]'', a one-act ''chinoiserie musicale'' with a libretto by [[Halévy]]. From this time performances were primarily given at the Salle Choiseul during the winter theatre season. The company performed at the Salle Lacaze during the 1856, 1857 and 1859 summer seasons,<ref>Yon 2000, pp. 760–762.</ref><ref>During the summer of 1858 the company went on tour, and Offenbach sublet the Salle Lacaze to [[Jean-Charles Deburau]] (Yon 2000, p. 201). During the summer of 1860 the company performed in Brussels and Lyon. Offenbach himself went to Berlin to supervise the rehearsals and conduct the Berlin premiere of ''Orphée aux enfers'' at the Friedrich-Wilhelmstädtisches Theater on 23 June 1860 (Yon 2000, pp. 232–233).</ref> however, in March 1861 legislation was enacted which prevented the company from using both theatres, and appearances at the Salle Lacaze were discontinued.<ref>Levin 2009, p. 401.</ref> In spite of the restrictions of the license, Offenbach began including longer, more substantial works which violated its terms. For instance, his two-act ''[[Orphée aux enfers]]'' with a cast of 16 received its first performance at the Salle Choiseul on 21 October 1858. Even after Offenbach resigned as the director in January 1862, the company continued at the Salle Choiseul, performing light operas by other composers as well as Offenbach.<ref name=BPwebsite/><ref name=Lamb/><ref name=Levin/><ref>Lamb, Andrew. ''"Orphée aux enfers"'' in Sadie 1992, vol. 3, pp. 774–776.</ref>
Upon the departure of Offenbach, the new director tore down the existing hall to erect a larger one with a capacity of 1100 spectators.<ref name=BPwebsite/>
== Legacy == While the Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens is indelibly linked to Offenbach, it has also been the venue for a number of other important works. In addition to Offenbach's own operettas, the theatre has seen the premieres of musical works by [[Florimond Ronger|Hervé]], [[Emmanuel Chabrier]] and [[Claude Terrasse]] and playwrights such as [[Robert de Flers]], [[Albert Willemetz]], [[Sacha Guitry]] and [[Henri Bernstein]].
From 1986 to 2007, the Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens was under the directorship of [[Jean-Claude Brialy]], who died of cancer in May 2007.

==List of directors== The Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens was founded as a private entrepreneurship.<ref>Levin indicates that the company was a private entrepreneurship from its founding in 1855 up until 1885, which is the extent of her coverage of the topic. See Table 16.8. "Chronology and administration of the Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens company" in Levin 2009, p. 399.</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Date !
